## Description {#details}

This is all the stuff common to all SmallVectors.

The template parameter specifies the type which should be used to hold the Size and Capacity of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector</a>, so it can be adjusted. Using 32 bit size is desirable to shrink the size of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector</a>. Using 64 bit size is desirable for cases like <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;char&gt;</a>, where a 32 bit size would limit the vector to ~4GB. SmallVectors are used for buffering bitcode output - which can exceed 4GB.

Definition at line 52 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/smallvector-h">SmallVector.h</a>.

## Protected Member Functions

### grow&#95;pod() {#a0fef5db8f0b473292cb9770075050da5}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class Size&#95;T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void SmallVectorBase::grow&#95;pod (void &#42; FirstEl, size&#95;t MinSize, size&#95;t TSize)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
This is an implementation of the grow() method which only works on POD-like data types and is out of line to reduce code duplication.

This function will report a fatal error if it cannot increase capacity.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/smallvector-h/#l00075">75</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/adt/smallvector-h">SmallVector.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/smallvector-cpp/#l00146">146</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/smallvector-cpp">SmallVector.cpp</a>.

### mallocForGrow() {#a2c068750374c249c3498144297eda93c}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class Size&#95;T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void &#42; SmallVectorBase::mallocForGrow (void &#42; FirstEl, size&#95;t MinSize, size&#95;t TSize, size&#95;t &amp; NewCapacity)</>}
  labels = {["protected"]}>
This is a helper for <em>grow()</em> that&#39;s out of line to reduce code duplication.

This function will report a fatal error if it can&#39;t grow at least to <code>MinSize</code>.

Set the array data pointer to <code>Begin</code> and capacity to <code>N</code>.

This does not construct or destroy any elements in the vector.
